body_html:
Great for giving us background.
one solution, would be asking sage maker a way to define hooks if you're using estimators.

another solution is using model_fn extension as follows:

est = model_to_estimator(...)
def new_model_fn(features, labels, mode, config):
  spec = est.model_fn(features, labels, mode, config)
  return spec._replace(...)
est = Estimator(model_fn=new_model_fn)

head: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/estimator/python/estimator/head.py

for example tf.contrib.estimator.multi_head

body:
Great for giving us background.
one solution, would be asking sage maker a way to define hooks if you're using estimators.

another solution is using model_fn extension as follows:
```
est = model_to_estimator(...)
def new_model_fn(features, labels, mode, config):
  spec = est.model_fn(features, labels, mode, config)
  return spec._replace(...)
est = Estimator(model_fn=new_model_fn)
```  
head: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/estimator/python/estimator/head.py

for example `tf.contrib.estimator.multi_head`
